sentences.en: Be sure not to become conceited.
Don't grow conceited over your successes.
sentences.cn: 你不要因为成功而变得自高自大.

sentences.en: Even if we achieve great success in our work, we should not be conceited.
sentences.cn: 即使我们在工作中取得了很大的成绩, 也不应该自满.

sentences.en: He became conceited after only modest success.
sentences.cn: 他在小有成就之后变得自负起来.

sentences.en: He could not bear that they should be so conceited.
sentences.cn: 他们这样自高自大他受不了.

sentences.en: I thought him conceited and arrogant.
sentences.cn: 我认为他既自负又傲慢。

sentences.en: I'm not as conceited as so many people seem to think.
sentences.cn: 我不像很多人认为的那么自负.

sentences.en: Many people become conceited after only modest success.
sentences.cn: 许多人在获得小小的成功后便变得自负起来.

sentences.en: Promoted too quickly, the conceited young man became overbearing.
sentences.cn: 提拔得太快, 那个自负的年轻人变得盛气凌人.

sentences.en: She was so self - conceited that she was averse to all advice from others.
sentences.cn: 她是如此 自命不凡,以致听不得别人的任何忠告.

sentences.en: The modest receive benefit, while the conceited reap failure.
They hated that conceited, self - satisfied creature.
sentences.cn: 他们讨厌那个高傲自满的家伙.
你这个自命不凡的蠢货。

sentences.en: You’re the most conceited, selfish person I’ve ever known.
sentences.cn: 你是我认识的人当中最自负、最自私的。

trans.tran_en: someone who is conceited thinks they are very clever, skilful, beautiful etc – used to show disapproval
